content:
By default, the jemallocator crates configure jemalloc inappropriately for cross-compiling the forthcoming aarch64-apple-darwin target. There's an environment variable that I should be able to set to work around it, but it would be nice if not everyone using jemallocator had to do the same.

I was about to look into creating a pull request, but it looks like the jemallocator repo hasn't been committed to in ~9 months and the last releases were ~15 months ago. I bring this up here because rustc depends on this crate on many platforms. Is a lack of updates something that the team is concerned about?
IIRC consensus is that we start maintaining relevant crates ourselves when upstream maintainership status becomes a problem, which in case of jemalloc hasnâ€™t come up as a problem.
